title: Organizational Activity Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of significant activities conducted by organizations in The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each activity type (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

resource_acquisition.description: Obtaining materials, funds, assets, or other valuable resources needed for operations.

political_maneuvering.description: Strategic actions to influence governance, policies, or power structures.

market_competition.description: Commercial activities aimed at gaining advantage or market share against rivals.

territorial_expansion.description: Extending physical control or presence into new geographic areas.

intelligence_gathering.description: Collecting and analyzing information about relevant entities or developments.

research_development.description: Creating new knowledge, technologies, or capabilities through investigation.

recruitment_campaign.description: Organized efforts to identify and attract new members to the organization.

public_relations.description: Managing public perception and image through communications and media engagement.

military_operation.description: Planned and coordinated use of force to achieve strategic objectives.

clandestine_mission.description: Secret operations conducted to achieve goals without attribution.

infrastructure_development.description: Building or improving physical facilities and systems that support operations.

community_service.description: Providing assistance, resources, or support to populations or areas.

economic_manipulation.description: Intentionally influencing markets, currencies, or financial systems for advantage.

diplomatic_initiative.description: Formal engagement with other organizations or entities to establish relationships or agreements.

cultural_promotion.description: Advancing specific cultural practices, arts, or identity markers.

religious_observance.description: Conducting or participating in spiritual ceremonies, rituals, or traditions.

technological_innovation.description: Developing new tools, systems, or applications of technical knowledge.

criminal_enterprise.description: Activities that violate laws or social norms for profit or advantage.

law_enforcement.description: Upholding rules, regulations, or laws through monitoring, prevention, and punishment.

education_program.description: Structured transmission of knowledge, values, or skills to members or outsiders.

media_campaign.description: Coordinated use of communication channels to promote specific messages or outcomes.

internal_restructuring.description: Reorganizing leadership, systems, or operations within the organization.

ritual_performance.description: Conducting symbolic ceremonies that reinforce values, identity, or mystical connections.

disaster_response.description: Providing aid, resources, or intervention during crises or catastrophes.

recreational_event.description: Organizing activities focused on entertainment, celebration, or social bonding.

trade_negotiation.description: Formal discussions to establish terms for exchange of goods or services.

environmental_initiative.description: Actions taken to protect, restore, or influence natural ecosystems.

magical_working.description: Conducting operations that involve supernatural forces or arcane energies.
